de.helpHistory2022: Die aktuelle Version von 2022 f√ºhrte eine bedeutende √Ñnderung ein: Das Buchstabieralphabet basiert nun auf deutschen St√§dtenamen. Dies macht die Codew√∂rter f√ºr deutsche Muttersprachler leichter zu merken und auszusprechen.

en.title: DIN 5009 Spelling Table
en.subtitle: German Spelling Alphabet according to DIN 5009:2022
en.helpSubtitle: German Spelling Alphabet according to DIN 5009:2022 ¬∑ Help
en.emptyState: Enter a word to see the spelling
en.helpPurpose1: This application allows you to spell German words using the official DIN 5009:2022 spelling alphabet. This is particularly useful when you need to spell words over the phone, via radio, or in other situations where misunderstandings should be avoided.
en.helpPurpose2: Simply enter a German word, and the application will immediately show you the correct spelling according to the DIN standard. You can also listen to the pronunciation of each code word and share the URL with the word to show others the spelling.
en.helpWhat1: DIN 5009 is a German standard that defines the spelling alphabet for the German language. It specifies which code words should be used for each letter of the alphabet to ensure clear and understandable communication.
en.helpWhat2: The standard is commonly used in the following areas:
en.helpUsage2: Radio communication (e.g., police, fire department, emergency services)
en.helpHistory2022: The current 2022 version introduced a significant change: The spelling alphabet is now based on German city names. This makes the code words easier to remember and pronounce for German native speakers.
en.helpHistory2022Change1: Switch to German city names as code words
en.helpHistory2022Change2: New code words for umlauts (√Ñ, √ñ, √ú) as "Umlaut" + base word
en.helpHistoryPrevious: Before version 2022, DIN 5009 used various code words that were partly based on international standards or used other German words. The switch to city names in version 2022 represents a modernization and simplification.
en.helpHistory1996: An earlier version that was used until the introduction of the 2022 version. This version had different code words that were not based on city names.
en.helpUsageStep1: Enter a German word in the input field
en.helpUsageStep2: The spelling is displayed automatically in real-time
en.helpUsageStep3: Click on the üîä symbol to hear the pronunciation of a code word
en.helpUsageStep4: Use the "Copy URL" button to share the spelling
en.helpUsageStep5: The URL can be saved as a bookmark or shared with others
en.helpExample: For the word "Hallo", the following spelling results:
